place.name: QUARRINGTON
place.gazetteerText: QUARRINGTON, a parish, with a neat small village, in Sleaford district, Lincoln; 1½ mile S W by W of Sleaford r. station. Post-town, Sleaford. Acres, 1, 620. Real property, £2, 605. Pop., 299. Houses, 63. The property is divided among a few. The manor belongs to the Marquis of Bristol. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £287.* Patron, the Marquis of Bristol. The church is old but good, and ha a fine spire. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
